member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Input.C1ComboBox.AutoSuggestMode
member.summary: Gets or sets an option that controls how candidates searching works in auto-suggest mode.

remarks.para: works together with and properties. The works only if CustomSource"/> or ListItems value is used in . The property does not have any effect if is any of AllSystemSources, AllUrl, FileSystem, FileSystemDirectories, HistoryList, None, RecentlyUsedList, HistoryList. The property does not have any effect if is any of Node or Append.
Items in Auto-Suggest mode are shown without images and formatting as a plain text.
enters in Auto-Suggest mode when user types a character sequence that matches the filtering criteria.

member.summary: Indicates that DropDownForm can contain focus.

member.summary: The end users are not allowed to change the width of the dropdown form resizing it.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.DropDownFormOptionsFlags.FixedHeight
member.summary: The end users are not allowed to change the height of the dropdown form resizing it.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.DropDownFormOptionsFlags.AlwaysPostChanges
member.summary: If this flag is set, the changes to the control Value can only be cancelled explicitly, with Esc key or using the CloseDropDown method, and implicit cancellation (when the form is closed because it loses focus) is disabled.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.DropDownFormOptionsFlags.NoCancelOnEscape
member.summary: If this flag is set, pressing the Esc key does not close the form.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.DropDownFormOptionsFlags.NoPostOnEnter
member.summary: If this flag is set, pressing the Enter key does not close the form.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.DropDownFormOptionsFlags.AutoResize
member.summary: If set, the dropdown form width is automatically adjusted to the width of the owner control before the form is shown.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.DropDownFormOptionsFlags.FixedSize
member.summary: = FixedWidth + FixedHeight

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Input.C1DropDownControl.DropDownStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style of the combo box.
member.remarks:
The DropDownStyle property specifies whether the text portion can be edited.
If the value is Default, the text is editable and the dropdown list is displayed by clicking the down arrow.
If the value is DropDownList, the text is not editable and the dropdown list is displayed by clicking any part of the control.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Input.C1Label.OnBorderColorChanged(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the event.
member.param: An that contains the event data.

remarks.para: Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
The OnBorderColorChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
Notes to Inheritors. When overriding OnBorderColorChanged in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's OnBorderColorChanged method so that registered delegates receive the event.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Input.C1TextBox.MaxLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of characters or bytes that the control can hold.
member.value:
The number of characters or bytes (determined by the LengthAsByte property) that can be entered into the control.
The default is zero.
member.remarks: The MaxLength property allows you to limit the number of characters a user can enter in the control. The default value is 0, which does not limit the number of characters. Any number greater than 0 indicates the maximum number of characters. The effects the displayed result along with the MaxLength property.
member.exception: If value is less than zero, an ArgumentOutOfRangeException is thrown.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Input.C1TextBox.MaxLineCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of lines.
member.value:
An int value that indicates the maximum number of lines.
The default is zero.

remarks.para: MaxLineCount limits the acceptable lines of text when the property is .
This property does not work with wrapped lines, so preferrable is to use MaxLineCount when property is .
The default value of this property, zero, means no limit.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Input.C1TextBox.MaxLengthUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the maximum number of characters that fit in the control are handled based on bytes, characters, or text elements.
member.remarks: Determines the unit for counting for the property. The value LengthUnit.Byte means the MaxLength is counted by Byte. The value LengthUnit.Char means the MaxLength is counted by Char.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Input.C1TextBox.ExitOnLastChar
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the next control in the tab order receives the focus as soon as the control is filled at the last character.
member.value:
if the focus is moved to the next control in the tab order as soon as the control is filled at the last character defined by the input control; otherwise, .
The default is .
member.remarks: The input focus moves to the next control when the last entered character causes the text to exceed the limit of the control.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Input.C1TextBox.ExitOnLeftRightKey
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the focus automatically moves to the previous or next control in the tab order when pressing the left or right arrow keys.
member.value:
One of the enumeration values.
The default is .
member.remarks: The value of this property indicates the key which moves the input focus to the next control. When the caret is at the last character of this control, focus moves out by pressing the right arrow key. When the caret is before the first character of this control, focus moves out by pressing the left key.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Input.C1TextBox.SetProposedValue(System.Object)
member.summary: This method works exactly as setting the Value property, except that it does not change the internal variable storing the value before editing, so the user can press Esc and restore the previous value. This method works only in edit mode. If the control is not in edit mode, this methods does nothing.
member.param: Value to set to the control.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Input.C1TextBox.OnBorderColorChanged(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the event.
member.param: An that contains the event data.

remarks.para: Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
The OnBorderColorChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
Notes to Inheritors. When overriding OnBorderColorChanged in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's OnBorderColorChanged method so that registered delegates receive the event.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Input.CharHelper.ToFullWidth(System.Char)
member.summary: Transforms the specified character to a full width character if possible. Ranges are Latin basic, Katakana and Hangul characters.
member.param: A Unicode character.
member.returns: Full width character of c, otherwise original character returned.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Input.CharHelper.ToFullWidth(System.Boolean@,System.Char[])
member.summary: Tansforms the specified character to a full width character if possible. This method differs from the other where it takes on an array of characters. In FarEast country there are times when multiple half width characters make a one full width character.
member.param: An array of characters.
When the soundex character is processed a true is returned; otherwise, a false returned.
member.returns: Full width character of c, otherwise the original character is returned.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Input.CharHelper.ToHalfWidth(System.Char)
member.summary: Converts the value of a Unicode character to it's half width equivalent. Ranges are Latin basic, Katakana and Hangul characters.
member.param: A Unicode character.

returns.para: The half width equivalent of c.
The unchanged value of c, if c is already a half width or not a multi-width character.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Input.CharHelper.ToHalfWidthEx(System.Char)
member.summary: Transforms the specified character to a half width character if possible. This method differs from the ToHalfWidth method where it tries to return the accurate half width character - which most likely happens in FarEast countries.
member.param: A Unicode character.
member.returns: A character array representing c in half width form. In most cases this array will have only one element.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Input.CharHelper.ToKatakana(System.Char)
member.summary: Converts the value of a Unicode character to it's "Katakana" equivalent. Special character handling for the Japanese language.
member.param: A Unicode character.

returns.para: The unchanged value of c, if c is already a Katakana or not Hiragana.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Input.CharHelper.ToKatakana(System.Char,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the value of a Unicode character to it's "Katakana" equivalent with an optional setting of full or half width. Special character handling for the Japanese language
member.param: A Unicode character.
true to return a full width Katakana, and false to return a half width Katakana.

returns.para: The unchanged value of c, if c is already a Katakana or not Hiragana.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Input.CharHelper.ToHiragana(System.Char)
member.summary: Converts the value of a Unicode character to it's "Hiragana" equivalent. Special character handling for the Japanese language.
member.param: A Unicode character.

returns.para: The unchanged value of c, if c is already a Hiragana or not Katakana.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Input.CharHelper.ToAnsi(System.Char)
member.summary: Converts the value of a Unicode character to it's ANSI equivalent.
member.param: A Unicode character.
member.returns: An Ansi character equivalent of c in the current culture.
member.remarks: Encodes the specified Unicode character to an ANSI character using the current culture.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Input.CharHelper.ToAnsi(System.Char,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts the value of a Unicode character to it's ANSI equivalent using the specified culture information.
member.param: A Unicode character.
A CultureInfo object. If a null reference is passed, the current culture is assumed.
member.returns: An Ansi character equivalent of c using the specified culture.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Input.CharHelper.ToSJIS(System.Char)
member.summary: Converts the value of a JIS (Japanese encoding) character to it's Shift-JIS equivalent.
member.param: A JIS character.

returns.para: The unchanged value of c, if c is not a full width character.

remarks.newpara: Converts a JIS character to it's equivalent Shift-JIS character - used in the Japanese language.
Please note that this method does not take a Unicode character as it's parameter - use the character value returned by the "ToJIS" method.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Input.CharHelper.ToJIS(System.Char)
member.summary: Converts the value of a Shift-JIS (Japanese encoding) character to it's JIS equivalent.
member.param: A Shift-JIS character.

returns.para: The unchanged value of c, if c is not a full width character.

remarks.newpara: Converts a Shift-JIS character to it's equivalent JIS character - used in the Japanese language.
Please note that this method does not take a Unicode character as it's parameter - use the character value returned by the "ToSJIS" method.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.NumberStyleFlags.None
member.summary: Indicates that none of the bit styles are allowed.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.NumberStyleFlags.AllowCurrencySymbol
member.summary: Indicates that the numeric string is parsed as currency if it contains a currency symbol; otherwise, it is parsed as a number.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.NumberStyleFlags.AllowDecimalPoint
member.summary: Indicates that the numeric string can have a decimal point.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.NumberStyleFlags.AllowExponent
member.summary: Indicates that the numeric string can be in exponential notation.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.NumberStyleFlags.AllowHexSpecifier
member.summary: Indicates that the numeric string can have notation that signifies that the number is hexadecimal.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.NumberStyleFlags.AllowLeadingSign
member.summary: Indicates that the numeric string can have a leading sign.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.NumberStyleFlags.AllowLeadingWhite
member.summary: Indicates that a leading white-space character is ignored during parsing.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.NumberStyleFlags.AllowParentheses
member.summary: Indicates that the numeric string can have one pair of parentheses enclosing the number.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.NumberStyleFlags.AllowThousands
member.summary: Indicates that the numeric string can have group separators.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.NumberStyleFlags.AllowTrailingSign
member.summary: Indicates that the numeric string can have a trailing sign.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.NumberStyleFlags.AllowTrailingWhite
member.summary: Indicates that trailing white-space character must be ignored during parsing.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.NumberStyleFlags.Any
member.summary: Indicates that all the AllowXXX bit styles are used.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.NumberStyleFlags.Currency
member.summary: Indicates all styles except AllowExponent and AllowHexSpecifier.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.NumberStyleFlags.Float
member.summary: Indicates that the AllowLeadingWhite, AllowTrailingWhite, AllowLeadingSign, AllowDecimalPoint, and AllowExponent styles are used.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.NumberStyleFlags.HexNumber
member.summary: Indicates that the AllowLeadingWhite, AllowTrailingWhite, and AllowHexSpecifier styles are used.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.NumberStyleFlags.Integer
member.summary: Indicates that the AllowLeadingWhite, AllowTrailingWhite, and AllowLeadingSign styles are used.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.NumberStyleFlags.Number
member.summary: Indicates that the AllowLeadingWhite, AllowTrailingWhite, AllowLeadingSign, AllowTrailingSign, AllowDecimalPoint, and AllowThousands styles are used.

member.summary: Indicates that the default formatting options must be used.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.DateTimeStyleFlags.AllowInnerWhite
member.summary: Indicates that extra white space characters in the middle of the string must be ignored during parsing.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.DateTimeStyleFlags.AllowLeadingWhite
member.summary: Indicates that leading white space characters must be ignored during parsing.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.DateTimeStyleFlags.AllowTrailingWhite
member.summary: Indicates that trailing white space characters must be ignored during parsing.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.DateTimeStyleFlags.AllowWhiteSpaces
member.summary: Indicates that extra white space characters anywhere in the string must be ignored during parsing.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.DateTimeStyleFlags.NoCurrentDateDefault
member.summary: Indicates that, if the parsed string contains only the time and not the date, the parsing methods assume the Gregorian date with year = 1, month = 1, and day = 1. If this value is not used, the current date is assumed.

member.summary: Specifies that the search will be from right to left instead of from left to right.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.RegexOptionFlags.Singleline
member.summary: Specifies single-line mode. Changes the meaning of the dot (.) so it matches every character (instead of every character except \n).

member.summary: The number is converted to the most compact decimal form, using fixed point or scientific notation.

member.summary: The number is converted to a string that represents a currency amount.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.FormatTypeEnum.FixedPoint
member.summary: The number is converted to a string of the form -ddd.ddd where each 'd' indicates a digit (0-9).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.FormatTypeEnum.StandardNumber
member.summary: The number is converted to a string of the form "-d,ddd,ddd.ddd", where each 'd' indicates a digit (0-9).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.FormatTypeEnum.Percent
member.summary: The number is converted to a string that represents a percent as defined by the property or the property.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.FormatTypeEnum.Scientific
member.summary: The number is converted to a string of the form "-d.dddE+ddd" or "-d.ddde+ddd", where each 'd' indicates a digit (0-9).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.FormatTypeEnum.RoundTrip
member.summary: The round-trip specifier guarantees that a numeric value converted to a string will be parsed back into the same numeric value. This format is supported by floating-point types only.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.FormatTypeEnum.Integer
member.summary: Displays number as a string that contains the value of the number in Decimal (base 10) format. This format is supported for integral types only.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.FormatTypeEnum.Hexadecimal
member.summary: The number is converted to a string of hexadecimal digits. This format is supported for integral types only.

member.summary: Converts to Boolean and shows No for false, Yes for true.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Input.FormatTypeEnum.OnOff

member.name: T:C1.Framework.Text.Lexicons.Lexicon
member.summary: Defines the Lexicon class.
member.remarks: Provides a tool, that can parse the key word form the text. Each key word take effecting by a IPattern interface, lexicon will try to find it by the order. The find is described by . You also can set the two kinds of relation ship: Repellency and Dependency. Repellency, make a pattern not take effecting, when a pattern has been matched. Dependency, make a pattern not take effecting, until a pattern has been matched.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.CharHelper.ToFullWidth(System.Boolean@,System.Char[])
member.summary: Tansforms the specified character to a full width character if possible. This method differs from the other where it takes on an array of characters. In FarEast country there are times when multiple half width characters make a one full width character.

When the soundex character is processed a true is returned; otherwise, a false returned.

returns.para: The half width equivalent of c.
The unchanged value of c, if c is already a half width or not a multi-width character.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.CharHelper.ToHalfWidthEx(System.Char)
member.summary: Transforms the specified character to a half width character if possible. This method differs from the ToHalfWidth method where it tries to return the accurate half width character - which most likely happens in FarEast countries.
member.param: A Unicode character.
member.returns: A character array representing c in half width form. In most cases this array will have only one element.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.EnumHelper.IsValid(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Check current value is a valid Enum type
member.param: An int indivate the value you want to check
An int indicate the minimum value of your enum type
An int indicate the maximum value of your enum type
member.returns: A bool indicate the check result, if current value is a valid enum type, return true; otherwise false
member.remarks: This method is applicable to check a Sequential defined not-flag-style enum type

member.name: M:C1.Framework.EnumHelper.IsValid(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Check current value is a valid Enum type
member.param: An int indivate the value you want to check
An int indicate the minimum value of your enum type
An int indicate the maximum value of your enum type
An int indicate the max count of bit for test enum value
member.returns: A bool indicate the check result, if current value is a valid enum type, return true; otherwise false
member.remarks:
This method is applicable to check a Sequential defined flag-style enum type
There is a enum value you want to test is 0x5f, in this enum type, the min value is 0x0f, and max value is 0x100, then this method called below can test its validation:
EnumHelper.IsValid(0x5f, 0x0f, 0x100, 8);
In this scenario, the four parameter is 8, because the max value is 0x100(Binary as 100000000), the max bits on value is 0xff (Binary as 11111111), it's the max number of bits on

member.name: T:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.BitsPerPixel
member.summary: Represents the bits-per-pixel of the bitmap.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.BitsPerPixel.SpecifiedByFormat
member.summary: The number of bits-per-pixel is specified or is implied by the JPEG or PNG format.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.BitsPerPixel.Bits1Monochrome
member.summary: Each bit in the bitmap array represents a pixel. the items member of color table contains two entries.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.BitsPerPixel.Bits4Colors16
member.summary: The bitmap has a maximum of 16 colors, the items member of color table contains up to 16 entries. Each pixel in the bitmap is represented by a 4-bit index into the color table.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.BitsPerPixel.Bits8Colors256
member.summary: The bitmap has a maximum of 256 colors, and the items member of color table contains up to 256 entries. Each byte in the array represents a single pixel.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.BitsPerPixel.Bits16TrueColors
member.summary: The bitmap has a maximum of 2^16 colors. In general, the color table is empty, each word in the bitmap array represents a single pixel

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.BitsPerPixel.Bits24TrueColors
member.summary: The bitmap has a maximum of 2^24 colors. In general, the color table is empty, each 3-byte triplet in the bitmap array represents the relative intensities of blue, green, and red, respectively, for a pixel.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.BitsPerPixel.Bits32TrueColors
member.summary: The bitmap has a maximum of 2^32 colors. In general, the color table is empty, each double-word in the bitmap array represents the relative intensities of blue, green, and red, respectively, for a pixel.

member.name: P:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.PatternBrush.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the pattern.
member.value: A structure that indicates the background color of the pattern.
member.remarks: If the value is Color.Empty the background color is the currrent background color of the device context.

member.name: P:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.PatternBrush.ForegroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color of the pattern.
member.value: A structure that indicates the foreground color of the pattern.
member.remarks: If the value is Color.Empty the foreground color is the currrent foreground color of the device context.

member.name: P:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.PatternBrush.Pattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern mask.
member.value: A int array that indicates the pattern. Each bit represents a pixel. 0 - indicates to fill the pixel with foreground color. 1 - indicates to fill the pixel with background color.
member.remarks: If the Pattern is null or empty, all pixel will be filled with background color.

member.name: T:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContextState
member.summary: Saves the state of the .

member.name: T:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode
member.summary: Represents the raster operation code.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode.Invert
member.summary: Inverts the destination rectangle.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode.Blackness
member.summary: Fills the destination rectangle using the color associated with index 0 in the physical palette. (This color is black for the default physical palette.)

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode.Whiteness
member.summary: Fills the destination rectangle using the color associated with index 1 in the physical palette. (This color is white for the default physical palette.)

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode.SourceCopy
member.summary: Copies the source rectangle directly to the destination rectangle.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode.SourcePaint
member.summary: Combines the colors of the source and destination rectangles by using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode.SourceAnd
member.summary: Combines the colors of the source and destination rectangles by using the Boolean AND operator.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode.SourceInvert
member.summary: Combines the colors of the source and destination rectangles by using the Boolean XOR operator.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode.SourceErase
member.summary: Combines the inverted colors of the destination rectangle with the colors of the source rectangle by using the Boolean AND operator.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode.NotSourceCopy
member.summary: Copies the inverted source rectangle to the destination.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode.NotSourceErase
member.summary: Combines the colors of the source and destination rectangles by using the Boolean OR operator and then inverts the resultant color.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode.MergeCopy
member.summary: Merges the colors of the source rectangle with the brush currently selected in hdcDest, by using the Boolean AND operator.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode.MergePaint
member.summary: Merges the colors of the inverted source rectangle with the colors of the destination rectangle by using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode.PatCopy
member.summary: Copies the brush currently selected in hdcDest, into the destination bitmap.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode.PatPaint
member.summary: Combines the colors of the brush currently selected in hdcDest, with the colors of the inverted source rectangle by using the Boolean OR operator. The result of this operation is combined with the colors of the destination rectangle by using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode.PatInvert
member.summary: Combines the colors of the brush currently selected in hdcDest, with the colors of the destination rectangle by using the Boolean XOR operator.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode.PatAnd
member.summary: Combines the colors of the brush currently selected in hdcDest, with the colors of the destination rectangle by using the Boolean And operator.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode.PatOr
member.summary: Combines the colors of the brush currently selected in hdcDest, with the colors of the destination rectangle by using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode.DestinationInvert
member.summary: Inverts the destination rectangle.

member.name: T:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.BackgroundMode
member.summary: Represents the mode of the background.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.BackgroundMode.Transparent
member.summary: Background remains untouched.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.BackgroundMode.Opaque
member.summary: Background is filled with the current background color before the text, hatched brush, or pen is drawn.

member.name: T:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.CircumDirection
member.summary: Represents the circum-direction.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.CircumDirection.Counterclockwise
member.summary: Figures drawn counterclockwise

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.CircumDirection.Clockwise
member.summary: Figures drawn clockwise.

member.name: T:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.PolyFillMode
member.summary: Enumerate the fill mode for region

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.PolyFillMode.Alternate
member.summary: Selects alternate mode (fills the area between odd-numbered and even-numbered polygon sides on each scan line).

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.PolyFillMode.Winding
member.summary: Selects winding mode (fills any region with a nonzero winding value).

member.name: T:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.GraphicsMode
member.summary: Define a enumeration indicates the graphics mode.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.GraphicsMode.Compatible
member.summary: The current graphics mode is the compatible graphics mode, a mode that is compatible with 16-bit Windows. In this graphics mode, an application cannot set or modify the world transformation for the specified device context. The compatible graphics mode is the default graphics mode.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.GraphicsMode.Advance
member.summary: Windows NT/2000/XP: The current graphics mode is the advanced graphics mode, a mode that allows world transformations. In this graphics mode, an application can set or modify the world transformation for the specified device context.
member.remarks: Windows 95/98/Me: This mode is not supported.

member.name: T:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.MappingMode
member.summary: Defines the unit of measure used to transform page-space units into device-space units, and also defines the orientation of the device's x and y axes.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.MappingMode.Anisotropic
member.summary: Logical units are mapped to arbitrary units with arbitrarily scaled axes. Use the WindowExtent and ViewportExtent properties to specify the units, orientation, and scaling.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.MappingMode.Isotropic
member.summary: Logical units are mapped to arbitrary units with equally scaled axes; that is, one unit along the x-axis is equal to one unit along the y-axis. Use the WindowExtent and ViewportExtent properties to specify the units and the orientation of the axes. Graphics device interface (GDI) makes adjustments as necessary to ensure the x and y units remain the same size (When the window extent is set, the viewport will be adjusted to keep the units isotropic).

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.MappingMode.Twips
member.summary: Each logical unit is mapped to one twentieth of a printer's point (1/1440 inch, also called a twip). Positive x is to the right; positive y is up.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.MappingMode.HiEnglish
member.summary: Each logical unit is mapped to 0.001 inch. Positive x is to the right; positive y is up.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.MappingMode.LoEnglish
member.summary: Each logical unit is mapped to 0.01 inch. Positive x is to the right; positive y is up.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.MappingMode.HiMetric
member.summary: Each logical unit is mapped to 0.01 millimeter. Positive x is to the right; positive y is up.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.MappingMode.LoMetric
member.summary: Each logical unit is mapped to 0.1 millimeter. Positive x is to the right; positive y is up.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.MappingMode.Text
member.summary: Each logical unit is mapped to one device pixel. Positive x is to the right; positive y is down.

member.name: T:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the text alignment by using a mask of the values in the following list. Only one flag can be chosen from those that affect horizontal and vertical alignment.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextAlignment.Left
member.summary: The reference point will be on the left edge of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextAlignment.Right
member.summary: The reference point will be on the right edge of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextAlignment.Center
member.summary: The reference point will be aligned horizontally with the center of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextAlignment.Top
member.summary: The reference point will be on the top edge of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextAlignment.Bottom
member.summary: The reference point will be on the bottom edge of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextAlignment.Baseline
member.summary: The reference point will be on the base line of the text.

member.name: T:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat
member.summary: Specifies the method of formatting the text.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.Default
member.summary: The default text format is "Top|Left".

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.Top
member.summary: Justifies the text to the top of the rectangle.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.VerticalCenter
member.summary: Centers text vertically. This value is used only with the SingleLine value.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.Bottom
member.summary: Justifies the text to the bottom of the rectangle. This value is used only with the SingleLine value.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.Left
member.summary: Aligns text to the left.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.HorizontalCenter
member.summary: Centers text horizontally in the rectangle.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.Right
member.summary: Aligns text to the right.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.EndEllipsis
member.summary: For displayed text, if the end of a string does not fit in the rectangle, it is truncated and ellipses are added. If a word that is not at the end of the string goes beyond the limits of the rectangle, it is truncated without ellipses.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.WordEllipsis
member.summary: Truncates any word that does not fit in the rectangle and adds ellipses.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.PathEllipsis
member.summary: For displayed text, replaces characters in the middle of the string with ellipses so that the result fits in the specified rectangle. If the string contains backslash (\) characters, PathEllipsis preserves as much as possible of the text after the last backslash.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.NoPrefix
member.summary: Turns off processing of prefix characters.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.HidePrefix
member.summary: Ignores the ampersand (&) prefix character in the text. The letter that follows will not be underlined, but other mnemonic-prefix characters are still processed.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.PrefixOnly
member.summary: Draws only an underline at the position of the character following the ampersand (&) prefix character.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.NoClip
member.summary: Draws without clipping.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.ExternalLeading
member.summary: Includes the font external leading in line height. Normally, external leading is not included in the height of a line of text.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.EditControl
member.summary: Duplicates the text-displaying characteristics of a multiline edit control. Specifically, the average character width is calculated in the same manner as for an edit control, and the function does not display a partially visible last line.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.RightToLeft
member.summary: Layout in right-to-left reading order for bi-directional text when the font selected into the device context is a Hebrew or Arabic font. The default reading order for all text is left-to-right.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.SingleLine
member.summary: Displays text on a single line only. Carriage returns and line feeds do not break the line.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.WordBreak
member.summary: Breaks words. Lines are automatically broken between words if a word would extend past the edge of the pecified rectangle. A carriage return-line feed sequence also breaks the line.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.NoFullWidthCharacterBreak
member.summary: Prevents a line break at a DBCS (double-wide character string), so that the line breaking rule is equivalent to SBCS strings.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.TextFormat.ExpandTabs
member.summary: Expands tab characters. The default number of characters per tab is eight.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.SelectObject(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Selects an object into the specified device context(DC). The new object replaces the previous object of the same type.
member.param: A that indicates the handle to the gdi object to be selected.
member.returns: Returns the handle of the previous gdi object of the same type.
member.remarks: Note: When the handle of a gdi object is selected to , the properties of the gdi object can not changed and the gdi object can not be disposed.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.DeleteObject(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Deletes a logical pen, brush, font, bitmap, region, or palette, freeing all system resources associated with the object. After the object is deleted, the specified handle is no longer valid.
member.param: Handle to a logical pen, brush, font, bitmap, region, or palette.
member.remarks: Do not delete a drawing object (pen or brush) while it is still selected into a DC. When a pattern brush is deleted, the bitmap associated with the brush is not deleted. The bitmap must be deleted independently.
member.exception: If the specified handle is not valid or is currently selected into a DC, it would throw a .

member.name: P:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the background of the device context.
member.value: A structure that indicates the color of the background of the device context.

remarks.para: If the background mode is is , the background color is used to fill gaps between styled lines, gaps between hatched lines in brushes, and character cells. The background color is also used when converting bitmaps from color to monochrome and vice versa.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.SetBackgroundColor(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Sets the color of the background of the device context.
member.value: Returns the previous color of the background of the device context.
member.para: If the background mode is is , the background color is used to fill gaps between styled lines, gaps between hatched lines in brushes, and character cells. The background color is also used when converting bitmaps from color to monochrome and vice versa.

member.name: P:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.ForegroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the foreground of the device context.
member.value: A structure that indicates the color of the foreground of the device context.
member.remarks: The Color is used to draw the face of each character written by the TextOut and ExtTextOut functions. The Color is also used in converting bitmaps from color to monochrome and vice versa.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.SetForegroundColor(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Sets the color of the foreground of the device context.
member.value: Returns the previous color of the foreground of the device context.
member.remarks: The Color is used to draw the face of each character written by the TextOut and ExtTextOut functions. The Color is also used in converting bitmaps from color to monochrome and vice versa.

member.name: P:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.BackgroundMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the background mode of the device context.
member.value: A structure that indicates the background mode of the device context.

remarks.para: The BackgroundMode affects the line styles for lines drawn using a pen created by the CreatePen GDI API function. The BackgroundMode does not affect lines drawn using a pen created by the ExtCreatePen GDI API function.
value parameter can also be set to driver-specific values. GDI passes such values to the device driver and otherwise ignores them.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.SetBackgroundMode(C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.BackgroundMode)
member.summary: Sets the background mode of the device context.
member.value: Returns the previous foreground mode of the device context.

remarks.para: The BackgroundMode affects the line styles for lines drawn using a pen created by the CreatePen GDI API function. The BackgroundMode does not affect lines drawn using a pen created by the ExtCreatePen GDI API function.
backgroundMode parameter can also be set to driver-specific values. GDI passes such values to the device driver and otherwise ignores them.

member.name: P:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.RasterOperationCode
member.summary: Get or set the current foreground mix mode.GDI uses the foreground mix mode to combine pens and interiors of filled objects with the colors already on the screen. The foreground mix mode defines how colors from the brush or pen and the colors in the existing image are to be combined.
member.value: Specifies the mix mode. This parameter can be one of the following values.
member.remarks: Mix modes define how GDI combines source and destination colors when drawing with the current pen. The mix modes are binary raster operation codes, representing all possible Boolean functions of two variables, using the binary operations AND, OR, and XOR (exclusive OR), and the unary operation NOT. The mix mode is for raster devices only; it is not available for vector devices.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.GetRasterOperationCode
member.summary: retrieves the foreground mix mode of the specified device context. The mix mode specifies how the pen or interior color and the color already on the screen are combined to yield a new color.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value specifies the foreground mix mode. otherwise zero indicates failed.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.SetRasterOperationCode(C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode)
member.summary: Sets the current foreground mix mode. GDI uses the foreground mix mode to combine pens and interiors of filled objects with the colors already on the screen. The foreground mix mode defines how colors from the brush or pen and the colors in the existing image are to be combined.
member.param: Specifies the mix mode. This parameter can be one of the following values.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value specifies the previous mix mode. otherwise, zero indicates failed
member.remarks: Mix modes define how GDI combines source and destination colors when drawing with the current pen. The mix modes are binary raster operation codes, representing all possible Boolean functions of two variables, using the binary operations AND, OR, and XOR (exclusive OR), and the unary operation NOT. The mix mode is for raster devices only; it is not available for vector devices.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.DrawArc(System.Drawing.Point,System.UInt32,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Draws a line segment and an arc. The line segment is drawn from the position which is defined by radius and startAngle. The arc is drawn along the perimeter of a circle with the given radius and center. The length of the arc is defined by the given start and sweep angles.
member.param: A specifies the center of the circle.
A uint specifies the radius of the circle. This value must be positive.
A float specifies the start angle, in degrees.
A float specifies the sweep angle, in degrees, relative to the starting angle.
member.remarks: The arc is drawn by constructing an imaginary circle around the specified center point with the specified radius. The starting point of the arc is determined by measuring counterclockwise from the x-axis of the circle by the number of degrees in the start angle. The ending point is similarly located by measuring counterclockwise from the starting point by the number of degrees in the sweep angle. If the sweep angle is greater than 360 degrees,the arc is swept multiple times.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.DrawArc(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Point,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Draws an elliptical arc.
member.param: A specifies the bounding rectangle.
A specifies the ending point of the radial line defining the starting point of the arc.
A specifies the ending point of the radial line defining the ending point of the arc.
member.remarks: The rectangle specify the bounding rectangle. An ellipse formed by the specified bounding rectangle defines the curve of the arc. The arc extends in the current drawing direction from the point where it intersects the radial from the center of the bounding rectangle to the firstRadial point. The arc ends where it intersects the radial from the center of the bounding rectangle to the secondRadial point. If the starting point and ending point are the same, a complete ellipse is drawn.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.DrawLine(System.Drawing.Point,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Draws the special line by using the current pen of the device context.
member.param: A indicate the line start point
A indicate the line end point

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.DrawPolyLine(System.Drawing.Point[])
member.summary: Draws a series of line segments by connecting the points in the specified array.
member.param: A array indicates the line segments.

remarks.para:
The lines are drawn from the first point through subsequent points by using the current pen. Windows 95/98/Me: DrawPolyLine cannot draw more than a certain number of points. The limit depends on the line width (that is, the width of the pen selected into the DC)
Line widthMaximum points allowed line width is 1 16K line width > 1 (that is, wideline) and device supports wideline 16K line width > 1 but device does not support wideline approximately 1360 (that is, approximately 16K/12)

Any extra points are ignored. To draw a line with more points, divide the data into groups that have less than the maximum number of points and call the function for each group of points. Remember to connect the line segments.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.DrawPolyBezier(System.Drawing.Point[])
member.summary: Draws one or more Bezier curves.
member.param: An array of structures that contain the endpoints and control points of the curve(s). This value must be one more than three times the number of curves to be drawn, because each Bzier curve requires two control points and an endpoint, and the initial curve requires an additional starting point.

remarks.para: DrawPolyBezier draws cubic Bzier curves by using the endpoints and control points specified by the points parameter. The first curve is drawn from the first point to the fourth point by using the second and third points as control points. Each subsequent curve in the sequence needs exactly three more points: the ending point of the previous curve is used as the starting point, the next two points in the sequence are control points, and the third is the ending point.

The lines are drawn from the first point through subsequent points by using the current pen. Windows 95/98/Me: DrawPolyBezier cannot draw more than a certain number of points. The limit depends on the line width (that is, the width of the pen selected into the DC)
Line widthMaximum points allowed line width is 1 16K line width > 1 (that is, wideline) and device supports wideline 16K line width > 1 but device does not support wideline approximately 1360 (that is, approximately 16K/12)

Any extra points are ignored. To draw a line with more points, divide the data into groups that have less than the maximum number of points and call the function for each group of points. Remember to connect the line segments.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.PaintChord(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Point,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Paints a chord (a region bounded by the intersection of an ellipse and a line segment, called a secant). The chord is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush.
member.param: A indicates the bounds of the ellipse.
A indicates the endpoint of the first radial.
A indicates the endpoint of the second radial.

remarks.para: The curve of the chord is defined by an ellipse that fits the specified bounding rectangle. The curve begins at the point where the ellipse intersects the first radial and extends counterclockwise to the point where the ellipse intersects the second radial. The chord is closed by drawing a line from the intersection of the first radial and the curve to the intersection of the second radial and the curve.
If the starting point and ending point of the curve are the same, a complete ellipse is drawn.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.PaintEllipse(System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Paints an ellipse. The center of the ellipse is the center of the specified bounding rectangle. The ellipse is outlined by using the current pen and is filled by using the current brush.
member.param: A indicates the bounding rectangle.
member.remarks: Windows 95/98/Me: The sum of the coordinates of the bounding rectangle cannot exceed 32,767. The width of rectangle or the height of rectangle cannot exceed 32,767.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.PaintPie(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Point,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Paints a pie-shaped wedge bounded by the intersection of an ellipse and two radials. The pie is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush.
member.param: A indicates the bounds of the ellipse.
A indicates the endpoint of the first radial.
A indicates the endpoint of the second radial.
member.remarks: The curve of the pie is defined by an ellipse that fits the specified bounding rectangle. The curve begins at the point where the ellipse intersects the first radial and extends counterclockwise to the point where the ellipse intersects the second radial.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.PaintPolygon(System.Drawing.Point[])
member.summary: Paints a polygon consisting of two or more vertices connected by straight lines. The polygon is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush and polygon fill mode.
member.param: A structures that specify the vertices of the polygon.

remarks.para: The polygon is closed automatically by drawing a line from the last vertex to the first.

Windows 95/98/Me: PaintPolygon cannot draw more than a certain number of points. The limit depends on the line width (that is, the width of the pen selected into the DC)
Line widthMaximum points allowed line width is 1 16K line width > 1 (that is, wideline) and device supports wideline 16K line width > 1 but device does not support wideline approximately 1360 (that is, approximately 16K/12)

Any extra points are ignored. To draw a line with more points, divide the data into groups that have less than the maximum number of points and call the function for each group of points. Remember to connect the line segments.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.PaintRectangle(System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Draw the special rectangle by using the current pen of the device context and fill the rectangle by using the current brush of the device context.
member.param: A indicate the rectangle to paint.
member.remarks: The rectangle that is drawn excludes the bottom and right edges. If a is used, the dimensions of the rectangle are 1 pixel less in height and 1 pixel less in width.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.PaintRoundRectangle(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Paints a rectangle with rounded corners. The rectangle is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush.
member.param: A indicates the rectangle to paint.
An int indicates the width of the ellipse used to draw the rounded corners.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.Copy(C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Point,C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode)
member.summary: Performs a bit-block transfer of the color data corresponding to a rectangle of pixels from the specified source object into a destination DeviceContext object.
member.param: The source object.
A indicates the destination rectangle.
A indicates the upper-left corner of source rectangle. The width and height of source rectangle are same as the destination rectangle.
A indicates the raster operation code.

remarks.para: Copy only does clipping on the destination DC.

If a rotation or shear transformation is in effect in the source device context, Copy will throw a . If other transformations exist in the source device context (and a matching transformation is not in effect in the destination device context), the rectangle in the destination device context is stretched, compressed, or rotated, as necessary.
If the color formats of the source and destination device contexts do not match, the Copy function converts the source color format to match the destination format.
When an enhanced metafile is being recorded, an error occurs if the source device context identifies an enhanced-metafile device context. it means a would be throw out.
Not all devices support the Copy function. For more information, see the RC_BITBLT raster capability entry in the GetDeviceCaps function as well as the following: MaskBlt, PlgBlt, and StretchBlt.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.Copy(C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Rectangle,C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.RasterOperationCode)
member.summary: Performs a bit-block transfer of the color data corresponding to a rectangle of pixels from the specified source object into a destination DeviceContext object.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.InvertRectangle(System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Inverts a rectangle in a window by performing a logical NOT operation on the color values for each pixel in the rectangle's interior.
member.param: A structure that contains the logical coordinates of the rectangle to be inverted.
member.remarks: On monochrome screens, InvertRectangle makes white pixels black and black pixels white. On color screens, the inversion depends on how colors are generated for the screen. Calling InvertRectangle twice for the same rectangle restores the display to its previous colors.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.InvertRegion(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Inverts the colors in the specified region.
member.param: A indicates the handle of the region.
member.remarks: On monochrome screens, the InvertRegion function makes white pixels black and black pixels white. On color screens, this inversion is dependent on the type of technology used to generate the colors for the screen.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.GetPixel(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: retrieves the red, green, blue (RGB) color value of the pixel at the specified coordinates.
member.param: Specifies the coordinate, in logical units, of the pixel to be examined.
member.returns: The return value is the RGB value of the pixel. If the pixel is outside of the current clipping region, the return value is Color.Empty.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.SetPixel(System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Sets the pixel at the specified coordinates to the closest approximation of the specified color. The point must be in the clipping region and the visible part of the device surface.
member.param: Specifies the color to be used to paint the point.
Specifies the coordinate, in logical units, of the point to be set.

member.name: P:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.ClippingRegion
member.summary: Gets or sets the handle of the current clipping region of the device context.
member.value: A that indicates the handle of the clipping region.

remarks.para: Note: [Get] The getting region is a copy of the current region. [Set] Only a copy of the setting region is used. The region itself can be seted for any number of other device contexts or it can be deleted.
To remove a device-context's clipping region, specify a IntPtr.Zero region handle.
The coordinate of region will not be effected by current origin of page space.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.SetClippingRegion(System.IntPtr,System.Drawing.Drawing2D.CombineMode)
member.summary: Combines the specified region with the current clipping region using the specified mode.
member.param: A that indicates handle to the region to be selected. This handle can only be IntPtr.Zero when the CombineMode.Replace mode is specified
A that indicates the combine mode.
member.remarks: The coordinate of region will not be effected by current origin of page space.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.TranslateClippingRegion(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the clipping region of a device context by the specified offsets.
member.param: Specifies the number of logical units to move left or right.
Specifies the number of logical units to move up or down.

member.summary: Clips the device context by the specified rectangle and operation mode.
member.param: A indicates the rectangle.
A indicates operation mode.
member.remarks: The coordinate of rectangle is base one the space page.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.GetClippingBox
member.summary: Retrieves the dimensions of the tightest bounding rectangle that can be drawn around the current visible area on the device. The visible area is defined by the current clipping region or clip path, as well as any overlapping windows.
member.returns: A indicates the dimensions, in logical units.

member.remarks: Notes: The length of the array must be six.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.PointLogicalToDevice(System.Drawing.Point[])
member.summary: converts logical coordinates into device coordinates. The conversion depends on the mapping mode of the device context, the settings of the origins and extents for the window and viewport, and the world transformation.
member.param: An array of structures. The x- and y-coordinates contained in each structure will be transformed.
member.returns: An array of structures indicate the point which is converted to Device coordinates

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.PointDeviceToLogical(System.Drawing.Point[])
member.summary: converts device coordinates into logical coordinates. The conversion depends on the mapping mode of the device context, the settings of the origins and extents for the window and viewport, and the world transformation.
member.param: An array of structures. The x- and y-coordinates contained in each structure will be transformed.
member.returns: An array of structures indicate the point which is converted to Logical coordinates

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.TextOut(System.String,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Writes a character string at the specified location, using the currently selected font, background color, and text color.
member.param: A string that saves the characters to be written.
A that indicates the reference point that the system uses to align the string.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.TextExtent(System.String)
member.summary: Computes the width and height of the specified string of text.
member.param: A string that saves a character string to be computed.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the dimensions of the string in logical units.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.TextExtentEx(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Retrieves the number of characters in a specified string that will fit within a specified space and fills an array with the text extent for each of those characters.
member.param: A string for which extents are to be retrieved.
Specifies the maximum allowable width, in logical units, of the formatted string.
Receives a count of the maximum number of characters that will fit in the space specified by the maxExtent parameter.

Pointer to an array of integers that receives partial string extents. Each element in the array gives the distance, in logical units, between the beginning of the string and one of the characters that fits in the space specified by the maxExtent parameter. This array must have at least as many elements as character count in text. The function fills the array with valid extents for as many characters as are specified by the fitCharNumber parameter.
member.returns: Receives the dimensions of the string, in logical units.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.TabbedTextOut(System.String,System.Drawing.Point,System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a character string at a specified location, expanding tabs to the values specified in an array of tab-stop positions. Text is written in the currently selected font, background color, and text color.
member.param: A string that saves the characters to be written.
A that indicates the reference point that the system uses to align the string.
Specifies the x-coordinate of the starting position from which tabs are expanded.
member.returns: Returns the dimensions, of the string.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.TabbedTextExtent(System.String,System.Int32[],System.Drawing.Size@)
member.summary: The TabbedTextExtent method computes the width and height of a character string.If the string contains one or more tab characters, the width of the string is based upon the specified tab stops. The TabbedTextExtent method uses the currently selected font to compute the dimensions of the string.
member.param: A string that saves a character string to be computed.
An array containing the tab-stop positions, in device units. The tab stops must be sorted in increasing order; the smallest x-value should be the first item in the array.
If the function succeeds, the value is the dimensions of the string in logical units. Else the value is Size.Empty.
member.returns: Retrun a value indictaes whether this function succeed or not.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.SetTextJustification(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Specifies the amount of space the system should add to the break characters in a string of text. The space is added when an application calls the TextOut method.
member.param: Specifies the total extra space, in logical units, to be added to the line of text.
Specifies the number of break characters in the line.

member.name: P:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.TextCharacterExtra
member.summary: Gets or sets the current intercharacter spacing for the device context.
member.value: Specifies the amount of extra space to be added to each character.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.DeviceContexts.DeviceContext.SetTextCharacterExtra(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the current intercharacter spacing for the device context.
member.param: Specifies the amount of extra space to be added to each character.
member.returns: Returns the previous intercharacter spacing.

member.name: T:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric
member.summary: Represents the basic information about a physical font.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height (ascent + descent) of characters.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric.Ascent
member.summary: Specifies the ascent (units above the base line) of characters.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric.Descent
member.summary: Specifies the descent (units below the base line) of characters.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric.InternalLeading
member.summary: Specifies the amount of leading (space) inside the bounds set by the tmHeight member. Accent marks and other diacritical characters may occur in this area. The designer may set this member to zero.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric.ExternalLeading
member.summary: Specifies the amount of extra leading (space) that the application adds between rows. Since this area is outside the font, it contains no marks and is not altered by text output calls in either OPAQUE or TRANSPARENT mode. The designer may set this member to zero.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric.AveCharWidth
member.summary: Specifies the average width of characters in the font (generally defined as the width of the letter x). This value does not include the overhang required for bold or italic characters.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric.MaxCharWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the widest character in the font.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric.Weight
member.summary: Specifies the weight of the font.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric.Overhang
member.summary: Specifies the extra width per string that may be added to some synthesized fonts. When synthesizing some attributes, such as bold or italic, graphics device interface (GDI) or a device may have to add width to a string on both a per-character and per-string basis.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric.DigitizedAspectX
member.summary: Specifies the horizontal aspect of the device for which the font was designed.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric.DigitizedAspectY
member.summary: Specifies the vertical aspect of the device for which the font was designed. The ratio of the tmDigitizedAspectX and tmDigitizedAspectY members is the aspect ratio of the device for which the font was designed.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric.FirstChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the first character defined in the font.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric.LastChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the last character defined in the font.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric.DefaultChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the character to be substituted for characters not in the font.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric.BreakChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the character that will be used to define word breaks for text justification.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric.Italic
member.summary: Specifies an italic font if it is nonzero.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric.Underlined
member.summary: Specifies an underlined font if it is nonzero.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontMetric.StruckOut
member.summary: Specifies a strikeout font if it is nonzero.

member.summary: Specifies information about the pitch, the technology, and the family of a physical font.

member.name: T:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontBuilder
member.summary: Represents a class that is used to builder some complex fonts.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontBuilder.#ctor(C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.Font)
member.summary: Initialize a new from a
member.param: A indicate the template

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontBuilder.#ctor(System.Drawing.Font)
member.summary: Initialize a new from a
member.param: A indicate the template

member.summary: Initialize a new
member.param: A null-terminated string that specifies the typeface name of the font. The length of this string must not exceed 32 characters, including the terminating null character. The EnumFontFamiliesEx function can be used to enumerate the typeface names of all currently available fonts. If faceName is an empty string, GDI uses the first font that matches the other specified attributes.
Specifies the family of the font

Specifies the height, in logical units, of the font's character cell or character. The character height value (also known as the em height) is the character cell height value minus the internal-leading value.
Specifies the angle, in tenths of degrees, between the escapement vector and the x-axis of the device. The escapement vector is parallel to the base line of a row of text.

Specifies the average width, in logical units, of characters in the font. If width is zero, the aspect ratio of the device is matched against the digitization aspect ratio of the available fonts to find the closest match, determined by the absolute value of the difference.

Specifies the weight of the font in the range 0 through 1000. For example, 400 is normal and 700 is bold. If this value is zero, a default weight is used. The following values are defined for convenience.
Specifies an italic font if set to true.
Specifies an underlined font if set to true.
Specifies a strikeout font if set to true.
Specifies the angle, in tenths of degrees, between each character's base line and the x-axis of the device.
Specifies the character set.
Specifies the output precision. The output precision defines how closely the output must match the requested font's height, width, character orientation, escapement, pitch, and font type.
Specifies the clipping precision. The clipping precision defines how to clip characters that are partially outside the clipping region. It can be one or more of the following values.
Specifies the output quality. The output quality defines how carefully the graphics device interface (GDI) must attempt to match the logical-font attributes to those of an actual physical font.
Specifies the pitch of the font

member.name: P:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontBuilder.Height
member.summary: Get or set the height, in logical units, of the font's character cell or character. The character height value (also known as the em height) is the character cell height value minus the internal-leading value.
member.value:
An int indicate the height
if value larger than zero, the font mapper transforms this value into device units and matches it against the cell height of the available fonts.
if value equal zero, the font mapper uses a default height value when it searches for a match.
if value less than zero, the font mapper transforms this value into device units and matches its absolute value against the character height of the available fonts.

member.name: P:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontBuilder.Width
member.summary: Get or set the average width, in logical units, of characters in the font. If value is zero, the aspect ratio of the device is matched against the digitization aspect ratio of the available fonts to find the closest match, determined by the absolute value of the difference.
member.value: An int indicate the average width

member.name: P:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontBuilder.Escapement
member.summary: Get or set the angle, in tenths of degrees, between the escapement vector and the x-axis of the device. The escapement vector is parallel to the base line of a row of text.
member.value: An int indicate the escapement vector

remarks.para: Windows NT/2000/XP: When the graphics mode is set to GM_ADVANCED, you can specify the escapement angle of the string independently of the orientation angle of the string's characters.
When the graphics mode is set to GM_COMPATIBLE, Escapement specifies both the escapement and orientation. You should set Escapement and Orientation to the same value.
Windows 95/98/Me: The Escapement member specifies both the escapement and orientation. You should set Escapement and Orientation to the same value.

member.name: P:C1.Framework.Drawing.Gdi.FontBuilder.Orientation
